title: Pixel Device Unauthorized; No Pop-Up on Device to Authorize Computer for USB Debugging
content:
Hi!

I'm trying to enable and utilize USB Debugging on my Pixel device. An issue I'm encountering is that there is no pop up on my device asking me to authorize my computer when I plug my device in. Without this pop up, I have no other means to authorize USB Debugging between my computer and device. When I go to the command prompt and type "adb devices," it identifies my device; however, it states that it is unauthorized.

I have tried:
To revoke previous USB Debugging Authorization
Turned off and on the USB Debugging itself
Restarted my phone
Re-plugged my Pixel into the computer
Put the device into PTP Mode
Completed the commands “adb kill-server” & “adb start-server” & “adb usb” in the command prompt
Downloaded SDK Tool "Google USB Driver"
Installed the latest device drivers
Set the USB Configurations in Developer Options as MTP (Transfer Files)
Downloaded ADB (Android Debug Bridge) USB Debug Driver
And made sure that I'm using a USB-C Cable

Any help on this issue would be greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!
